edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.symmetricCrypto.encryption
Class ScCBCEncRandomIV

java.lang.Object
  edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.symmetricCrypto.encryption.ScCBCEncRandomIV
All Implemented Interfaces:
CBCEnc, SymmetricEnc, Cpa, Eav, EncSecLevel, Indistinguishable, SecurityLevel
public class ScCBCEncRandomIV
extends java.lang.Object
implements CBCEnc

This class performs the Cipher Block Chaining (CBC) Mode encryption and decryption. By definition, this encryption scheme is CPA-secure.

Author:
Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

Constructor Detail

ScCBCEncRandomIV

public ScCBCEncRandomIV()
Default constructor. Uses default implementation of prp, SecureRandom and padding.

ScCBCEncRandomIV

public ScCBCEncRandomIV(PseudorandomPermutation prp,
                        PaddingScheme padding)
Sets the underlying prp that determines the type of encryption that will be performed, and the padding scheme to use. A default source of randomness is used.

Parameters:
prp - the underlying pseudorandom permutation.
padding - the padding scheme to use.

ScCBCEncRandomIV

public ScCBCEncRandomIV(PseudorandomPermutation prp,
                        java.security.SecureRandom random,
                        PaddingScheme padding)
Sets the underlying prp that determines the type of encryption that will be performed, and the padding scheme to use. The random passed to this constructor determines the source of randomness that will be used.

Parameters:
prp - the underlying pseudorandom permutation.
random - a user provided source of randomness.
padding - the padding scheme to use.

ScCBCEncRandomIV

public ScCBCEncRandomIV(java.lang.String prpName,
                        java.lang.String paddingName,
                        java.lang.String randNumGenAlg)
                 throws FactoriesException,
                        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
By passing a specific Pseudorandom permutation we are setting the type of encryption scheme.

This constructor gets the name of a Pseudorandom permutation and is responsible for creating a corresponding instance.

It also gets the name of a Random Number Generator Algorithm to use to generate the source of randomness

and the name of a Padding Scheme.

Parameters:
prpName - the name of a specific Pseudorandom permutation, for example "AES".
paddingName - name of the Padding Scheme to use, for example "BitPadding".
randNumGenAlg - the name of the RNG algorithm, for example "SHA1PRNG"
Throws:
FactoriesException - if the given names are not valid prp name or padding name.
java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the given randNumGenAlg is not a valid random number generator.

ScCBCEncRandomIV

public ScCBCEncRandomIV(java.lang.String prpName,
                        java.lang.String paddingName)
                 throws FactoriesException
By passing a specific Pseudorandom permutation we are setting the type of encryption scheme.

This constructor gets the name of a Pseudorandom permutation and is responsible for creating a corresponding instance.

It also gets the name of a Padding Scheme. A defualt source of randomness is used.

Parameters:
prpName - the name of a specific Pseudorandom permutation, for example "AES".
paddingName - name of the Padding Scheme to use, for example "BitPadding".
Throws:
FactoriesException - if the given names are not valid prp name or padding name.

generateKey

public javax.crypto.SecretKey generateKey(java.security.spec.AlgorithmParameterSpec keyParams)
                                   throws java.security.spec.InvalidParameterSpecException
Generates a secret key to initialize this encryption with IV object. This function delegates the generation of the key to the underlying PRP. It should only be used if the Secret Key is not a string of random bits of a specified length.

Specified by:
generateKey in interface SymmetricEnc
Parameters:
keyParams - parameters needed to create the key.
Returns:
the generated secret key
Throws:
java.security.spec.InvalidParameterSpecException - if hte given keyParams does not match the prp type.

encrypt

public SymmetricCiphertext encrypt(Plaintext plaintext)
This function encrypts a plaintext. It lets the system choose the random IV.

Specified by:
encrypt in interface SymmetricEnc
Parameters:
plaintext - should be an instance of ByteArrayPlaintext.
Returns:
an IVCiphertext, which contains the IV used and the encrypted data.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no secret key was set.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given plaintext is not an instance of ByteArrayPlaintext.

encrypt

public SymmetricCiphertext encrypt(Plaintext plaintext,
                                   byte[] iv)
                            throws javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
This function encrypts a plaintext. It lets the user choose the random IV.

Specified by:
encrypt in interface SymmetricEnc
Parameters:
plaintext - should be an instance of ByteArrayPlaintext.
iv - random bytes to use in the encryption pf the message.
Returns:
an IVCiphertext, which contains the IV used and the encrypted data.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no secret key was set.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given plaintext is not an instance of ByteArrayPlaintext.
javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException - if the given IV length is not as the block size.
